channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Update Fatality Traffic Collision; INC#0520; 10:58AM; 17300 W Saticoy St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48ntZbo; #LakeBalboa; The adult male (sole) occupant of the pickup truck is deceased and remains at scene. The critically injured adult female was the driver and sole occupant of the coupe. She is being treated at a regional trauma center. No other injuries have been reported. Though there was rain in the area this morning, the specific cause of - and any factors related to the collision, will be formally determined by LAPD Valley Traffic Division investigators.; FS 100; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 E100 E104 E273 E290 E295 E73 EM10 HR3 JT2 RA100 RA73 SQ87 SQ95 T73 T90 T95 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Fatality Traffic Collision; INC#0520; 10:30AM; 17300 W Saticoy St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48ntZbo; #LakeBalboa; The pickup that struck the building was from a commercial pest control firm. Because the forceful collision(s) caused that truck's cargo of commercial pesticide *containers* to be ejected alongside the roadway and building, an LAFD Hazardous Materials Squad has been summoned per protocol to survey the scene and assure no actual pesticide *product* has been spilled. Though no escalating or off-site hazard has been identified, the immediate area of the collision has been cordoned off until the LAFD HazMat investigation is complete. No persons at the scene have any medical complaints, and there is no formal evacuation.; FS 100; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 E100 E104 E273 E290 E295 E73 EM10 HR3 JT2 RA100 RA73 SQ87 SQ95 T73 T90 T95 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Fatality Traffic Collision; INC#0520; 10:20AM; 17300 W Saticoy St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48ntZbo; #LakeBalboa; The incident involves *two* vehicles, one described as a coupe that remained in the roadway, the other a pick-up truck that struck the building.; FS 100; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 E100 E104 E273 E290 E295 E73 EM10 HR3 RA100 RA73 SQ87 SQ95 T73 T90 T95 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Fatality Traffic Collision; INC#0520; 09:42AM; 17300 W Saticoy St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48ntZbo; #LakeBalboa; PRELIM: Solo sedan vs. tree/commercial building, trapping two persons in the vehicle, one of whom (undetermined age/gender) is deceased and remains at scene. The other patient, an adult female, was disentangled from the wreckage by firefighters, and has been taken to a regional trauma center in critical condition. No other injuries. The vehicle struck, but did not penetrate the building, damaging a natural gas meter. No fire. LAFD crews were able to stop the leak of natural gas. So Cal Gas, L.A. Department of Building and Safety and L.A. Public Health (damaged business was a restaurant and therefore requires health department clearance) have been notified and are responding, unknown ETA. #LATraffic: Closure of one or more lanes of northbound Louise Avenue south of Saticoy Street by LADOT until LAPD and Medical Examiner operations are complete. Unknown ETO. Motorists, expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Detours are readily available. Monitor traffic reports on news radio. Transit Users: Follow @MetroLAAlerts on Twitter/X ( https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts) for any related service updates. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #1383). SoCal Gas, Building & Safety, Health Department, Medical Examiner and LADOT.; FS 100; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 E100 E104 E273 E290 E73 EM10 HR3 RA100 RA73 T73 T90 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Physical Rescue; INC#1036; 05:00PM; 2445 N Coldwater Canyon Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/49BR6jq; #BeverlyCrest; Firefighters successfully extricated two people from the overturned vehicle, and transported both to a local hospital. Unknown age/gender/condition. Nothing further.; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 5; BC14 E108 E278 E292 E71 E97 E99 EM14 HR3 RA37 RA71 RA78 RA97 T78 T92 UR88; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Physical Rescue; INC#1036; 04:19PM; 2445 N Coldwater Canyon Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/49BR6jq; #BeverlyCrest; Firefighters responding to one vehicle rollover with two patients trapped.; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 5; BC14 E108 E278 E292 E71 E97 RA71 RA78 RA97 T78 T92; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Update KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0011; 12:28AM; 20742 W Skouras Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/4bBpPzD; #Winnetka; Firefighters responded to a one-story home with fire showing from the attic. While crews prepared to advance hose lines inside the house and cut holes in the roof, others performed salvage operations inside (gathering valuables and belongings and covering them to avoid further damage due to smoke or water). Ultimately, it took 32 firefighters 17 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the attic fire. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 72; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E105 E293 E305 E72 E84 RA72 RA84 SO1 T105 T93; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0011; 12:11AM; 20742 W Skouras Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/4bBpPzD; #Winnetka; One-story single-family home with fire showing from the attic. All occupants have safely evacuated the home.; FS 72; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E105 E293 E305 E72 E84 RA72 RA84 SO1 T105 T93; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Update KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1386; 07:43PM; 11603 W Mississippi Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/4bUPDXF; Sawtelle; The first 26 firefighters responded to a vehicle fire in the garage of a two-story townhome. Crews quickly deployed hose lines, and contained the fire to the unit of origin, protecting the adjacent units on either side. No reported injuries. Fire cause under investigation. ; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC18 BC4 BC9 CM40 CM42 E19 E237 E263 E292 E37 E462 E59 EM18 RA59 RA892 SO1 T37 T63 T92; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1386; 07:17PM; 11603 W Mississippi Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/4bUPDXF; #Sawtelle; A vehicle burning in a garage has spread to a two story townhome. Firefighters are in offensive mode.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC18 BC9 E19 E237 E292 E37 E59 RA59 RA892 SO1 T37 T92; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange
